The mind is the root of suffering and joy.
People in the world only know to follow the flow and pursue the superficial.
They lose the source and are confused about the origin.
Practicing diligently but in vain for three asaṃkhyeya kalpas,
They go against the truth and become increasingly distant.
Accumulating merit but in vain for a long time,
They are still far from the Way.
Therefore, those who attain the fruit of sagehood,
Encounter this and happily call it beyond their share.
The great beings who appear in the world,
Facing this, have not yet realized the truth.
How much more so for the deluded and confused followers,
The dark beginning non-Buddhist teachings,
The arrogant officials in the lacquer garden,
And those who are confused and crazy.
How can they hope to believe and accept it?
Therefore, it is known that the fundamental mirror is difficult to believe.
Those who awaken are rare and extraordinary.
Not only do they attain the fundamental,
They are also able to deeply understand cause and effect.
Therefore, it is said to deeply believe in the Mahayana,
Not slandering cause and effect.
Therefore, all sentient beings,
Only create good and evil causes with their own minds,
Inviting the fruits of suffering and joy.
Or while in the intermediate state.
Those who do good deeds
Follow the light of purity.
Those who create evil causes
See the color of darkness.
Or on the day of entering the womb.
Those who accumulate pure karma
Ascend to the top of the tower.
Those who create black karma
Throw themselves into the grass and thorns.
And when born into the world as a human being.
The correct and the dependent are also divided into superior and inferior.
If one has blessings,
One will have the features of a swallow's chin and a dragon's face.
One will receive the glory of the flower hall and the golden house.
If one has few virtues,
One will manifest the form of the five exposed parts and be short.
One will dwell in the misfortune of a wine jar window and straw door.
It can be said that when the wind is harmonious, the sound follows.
When the form is upright, the shadow is straight.
Cause and effect are simultaneous.
Conditions meet without loss.
Then one should contemplate the nature of the Dharma realm.
All are created by the mind alone.
The Inner Virtues Treatise says:
The Lesser Vehicle considers the dependent environment to be created by karma.
The Greater Vehicle considers the myriad realms to be created by consciousness.
Following illusory karma, it is bestowed upon heaven and earth.
Following the deluded mind, it manifests as the land and plants.
If one sees it as a cataract seeing a flower in the sky,
It is like a dream showing one's birth and old age.
If one awakens to it in the mind's karma,
Then one only hears of the Buddha's Way.
